abstract: uncovering the secrets of the teifi valley in cynefin .
article: second episode of the s4c series pays a visit to south walesfollowing the first episode 's visit to bro ffestiniog , the area surrounding the teifi river will become the centre of attention in the second episode of the cynefin series , on the evening of sunday , january 14 . from the remarkable history of henllan church to the annual cenarth coracle race , viewers will have an opportunity to learn more about the traditions and folklore of one of our rural communities through the eyes of local experts . a new look at our communities in cynefinthe programme will prove an emotional rollercoaster as heledd cynwal , iestyn jones and siôn tomos owen delve deep into the history and mythology of bro emlyn .

the prisoner of war camp at henllan is known to many but the history of the church within it may not be so familiar . the camp , which was built at the beginning of the 1940s , was home at the time to over 1,000 italian prisoners of war . in response to their request , one of the huts was given to them to use as a church and as local historian jon meirion jones explains , it soon became a magnificent architectural building . publicity pic `` on receipt of the hut , the inventive prisoners went about transforming the building into a church with a glorious dome resplendent with a fresco of the last supper .

there are also seven medallions painted on paper on the beams with an identical one on the wall to the rear of the church . what 's extraordinary is the fact the colours continue to be as vibrant and beautiful today , something which amazes the visiting public ; the way it 's survived is incredible , '' says jon meirion jones . one of the area 's unique traditions interests iestyn jones and he competes in the annual coracle race in cenarth . a coracle is a small boat , traditionally moulded using wicker and animal skin . its lightness is an advantage for fishermen who carry it on their backs , but according to iestyn , the skill is in its navigation .

revisiting the children of 1989 - where are they now ? `` what could be so hard about rowing something as small as this ? quite a bit actually , as i discovered ; i came close to a soaking on several occasions . but the use of the coracle for fishing for the sumptuous sewin is an important tradition in this area , and although in danger of being lost , a conscious effort is now being made to ensure its future , '' explains iestyn jones . along with bro emlyn , the other areas to be visited in the rest of the series include merthyr tydfil , vale of clwyd , holy island and west anglesey , banw valley , amman valley and bala .

cynefin , sunday 14 january 14 , 8 pm , s4c welsh and english subtitles . on demand on s4c . cymru , bbc iplayer and other platforms . golwg newydd ar dir y teifiyn dilyn ymweliad â bro ffestiniog yn y bennod gyntaf , yr ardal o gwmpas afon teifi fydd yn mynd â 'n sylw yn ail bennod y gyfres cynefin , ar nos sul , ionawr 14.o hanes rhyfeddol eglwys henllan i ras gwryglau flynyddol cenarth , cawn gyfle i ddysgu mwy am draddodiadau a llên gwerin un o 'n cymunedau gwledig , a hynny drwy lygaid gwybodusion lleol .

caiff y llon a ' r lleddf sylw wrth i heledd cynwal , ynghyd â iestyn jones a siôn tomos owen , dyrchu i hanes a chwedloniaeth bro emlyn . mae gwersyll carcharorion rhyfel henllan yn wybyddus i nifer ond efallai nad yw hanes yr eglwys yno mor gyfarwydd i bobl . adeiladwyd y gwersyll ei hun ar ddechrau pedwardegau ' r ganrif ddiwethaf a bu 'n gartref i dros 1,000 o eidalwyr . ar eu cais hwy , neilltuwyd un cwt iddyn nhw greu eglwys babyddol , ac fel yr eglura ' r hanesydd lleol jon meirion jones , daeth hon yn adeilad pensaernïol godidog .

publicity pic `` wedi cael y cwt , aeth y carcharorion dyfeisgar ati i ' w drawsnewid i fod yn adeilad eglwysig gyda dom gogoneddus ag arno ffresco ' r swper olaf . mae yno hefyd saith o fedaliynau wedi'u paentio ar bapur ar y trawstiau ynghyd ag un cyffelyb ar fur yng nghefn yr eglwys . yr hyn sy 'n anhygoel yw bod y lliwiau 'n parhau 'n driw ac yn brydferth a dyna sy 'n synnu ymwelwyr ddaw i ' w gweld - mae ' r modd y mae wedi goroesi yn anhygoel , '' meddai jon meirion jones .

un o draddodiadau mwyaf unigryw ' r ardal fydd yn mynd â bryd iestyn jones wrth iddo fentro i gystadlu yn ras gwryglau flynyddol cenarth . math o gwch bychan yw ' r cwrwgl , wedi ei siapio yn draddodiadol o wiail a chroen anifail . ei fantais yw ei ysgafnder a gall pysgotwyr ei gario ar eu cefnau ond mae sgil penodol i ' w lywio , yn ôl iestyn . `` beth allai fod yn anodd am rwyfo peth mor fach â hyn ? wel , tipyn a dweud y gwir , fel dwi wedi'i ddarganfod gan ddod yn agos at wlychfa sawl gwaith .

ond mae defnyddio ' r cwrwgl i bysgota am y sewin blasus yn yr ardal hon yn draddodiad pwysig . ac er iddo fod mewn peryg o gael ei golli , mae ` na ymdrech benodol ar droed ar hyn o bryd i sicrhau ei fod yn parhau 'n fyw i ' r dyfodol , '' esbonia iestyn jones . ynghyd â bro emlyn , yr ardaloedd eraill fydd yn cael sylw dros yr wythnosau nesaf bydd merthyr tudful , dyffryn clwyd , ynys cybi a gorllewin môn , dyffryn banw , dyffryn aman a ' r bala . cynefin , nos sul , ionawr 14 , 8 pm , s4c isdeitlau cymraeg a saesneg .
